result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Kenneth Dixon

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDED 11-01-2022 - Defendant may possess weapons only for hunting purposes during hunting times only.**
11-02-2022 - E-mailed defendant's attorney advising defendant needed to come in to sign amended bond no later than 5:00 p.m., November 8, 2022.  kms

Defendant Robert Kenneth Dixon not in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for Robert Kenneth Dixon.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Grube.  Requesting to possess weapons only for hunting purposes during hunting times only.  Motion granted by the Court.  Close to a resolution; requesting 30 days for a potential plea.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Robert Kenneth Dixon not in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for Robert Kenneth Dixon.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDED 11-01-2022 - Defendant may possess weapons only for hunting purposes during hunting times only.**

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Kenneth Dixon in court. Attorney Josh Grube for defendant. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
